From: "projectcow@..." <projectcow@...>
Subject: Where do certain decide rules go? (migrating from 1.4 to 3.1)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=510581242; y=d7Dx4g9n3aqsDpHosyAA6EdGc9s3Cu1TYWkQxT3_d9JRL9mFiWW6WbauoHD_FyM
X-Yahoo-Profile: projectcow@...
X-eGroups-Approved-By: gojomo <gojomo@...> via web; 10 Dec 2011 20:31:19 -0000

Hi!
I have been using 1.4 for a while and am now switching to 3.1. I (1) cr=
awl text content only and (2) don't want to archive anything but successful=
 pages. I also want to have (3) strict quota rules for all servers. So far,=
 I've been expanding/modifying the default job that 3.1 generates with some=
 success.

However, is the following correct?

- I added a QuotaEnforcer to=
 the CandidateScoper to enforce quotas.
- I added a ContentTypeNotMatchesRe=
gexDecideRule to the "scope" DecideRuleSequence, which REJECTs for regex "t=
ext\/.*" to download only text content.

And finally, my primary question: =
Where do I add the FetchStatusDecideRule to store only sucessful (basically=
 "200") pages? In 1.4, the Archiver accepted its own rule sequence. How is =
that achieved in 3.1.

Sorry if the question/s is/are redundant. I am under=
 a bit of time pressure and would normally have done more research before a=
sking.

Thanks & cheers
Roland
